required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety/Efficacy of Nepafenac Punctal Plug Delivery System Compared to Placebo to Control Ocular Pain/Inflammation After Cataract
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study Evaluating Safety and Efficacy of a Nepafenac Punctal Plug Delivery System (N-PPDS) Compared With Placebo Punctal Plug Delivery System (p-PPDS) in Controlling Post-Operative Ocular Pain and Inflammation After Routine Unilateral Cataract Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 2, multi-center, randomized, parallel-arm, double-masked, placebo-controlled study. One (1) to 2 days prior to their scheduled cataract surgery, each study subject will be randomized (2:1) in to one of two treatment groups: N-PPDS or p-PPDS, which are inserted in the lower punctum of the subject's scheduled surgical eye. All plugs will remain in the study subject's lower punctum for a period of 2 weeks following cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a Phase 2, multi-center, randomized, parallel-arm, double-masked, placebo-controlled study. One (1) to 2 days prior to their scheduled cataract surgery, each study subject will be randomized (2:1) in to one of two treatment groups:
Group A: A total of 50 study subjects (50 eyes) will have an N-PPDS inserted in the lower punctum of their scheduled surgical eye.
Group B: A total of 25 study subjects (25 eyes) will have a p-PPDS inserted in the lower punctum of their scheduled surgical eye.
All plugs will remain in the study subject's lower punctum for a period of 2 weeks following cataract surgery.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Assessment of pain in subjects as measured by a scale of 0 - 5. Post-op pain scale: 0 represents absence of pain and 5 represents a definite, continuous unbearable ocular or periocular pain.

secondary_outcome.description: Anterior chamber cells are assessed using a scale of 0 - 4 with 0 representing no cells seen and 4 representing >30 cells seen.
Anterior chamber flare is assessed using a scale of 0 - 4 with 0 representing no Tyndall effect and 4 representing Tyndall effect in anterior chamber is very intense

arm_group.description: N-PPDS (Nepafenac Punctal Plug Deliver System) is an L-shaped, silicone punctal plug with a drug eluting core that contains nepafenac (active)
p-PPDS (placebo Punctal Plug Delivery System) is an L-shaped, silicone punctal plug with a drug insert that contains no active ingredient (placebo).

intervention.description: A punctal plug delivery system (PPDS) is being developed as a device that can deliver a sustained release of a drug to a specific eye. The PPDS is made up of a medical grade silicone punctal plug which holds an insert (core) that contains nepafenac, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug.

A punctal plug delivery system (PPDS) is being developed as a device that can deliver a sustained release of a drug to a specific eye. The PPDS is made up of a medical grade silicone punctal plug which holds an insert (core) that does not contain nepafenac.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. A male or female subject in good general health, â‰¥ 22 years of age at the time of the screening visit
2. A subject with a cataract for which routine phacoemulsification extraction and implantation of an intraocular lens has been planned
3. A subject has a lower puncta that can be dilated to 1.0 mm in their scheduled surgical eye
Exclusion Criteria:
1. A subject with a history of complications, adverse events, trauma or disease in the nasolacrimal area, whether or not it was due to punctal plug wear, including but not limited to dacryocystitis, inflammation or canaliculitis in either eye
2. A subject with structural lid abnormalities (e.g., ectropion, entropion) in their schedule surgical eye
3. A subject with a puncta >0.9 mm prior to dilation in their scheduled surgical eye
4. A subject with any signs of intraocular inflammation (cells/flare) in either eye at the screening visit
5. A subject with a known sensitivity to nepafenac or any inactive ingredient of the punctum plug, silicone, fluorescein, topical anesthetic, or any other products required for study procedures or cataract surgery
6. A subject with a history of chronic/recurrent inflammatory eye disease (e.g., scleritis, uveitis, herpes keratitis) in either eye

clinical_study.keyword: Treatment of pain and inflammation after Cataract Surgery

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

measure.description: Anterior chamber flare is assessed using a scale of 0 - 4 with 0 representing no Tyndall effect and 4 representing Tyndall effect in anterior chamber is very intense

category.title: Mild: Tyndall effect in anterior chamber is clearly visible
Moderate: Tyndall effect in anterior chamber is moderately intense
Severe: Tyndall effect in anterior chamber is very intense. The aqueous has a white milky appearance

reported_events.time_frame: The Nepafenac PPDS or Placebo PPDS was inserted 1-2 days prior to surgery. Subjects were followed for 14 days (+/-2 days) post op
reported_events.desc: Subjects were asked: "Have you had any problems since your last visit?"

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
